alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 9:40AM CST until February 06 at 12:16AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mobile AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Alabama... Burnt Corn Creek Near Brewton affecting Escambia County. For the Burnt Corn Creek...including Brewton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Burnt Corn Creek Near Brewton. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Persimmon and Ann Street begin to flood. Jennings Park on left bank of the creek is flooded along with Highway 41 near the park. This is the critical stage for the Grede Foundry in Brewton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CST Saturday the stage was 16.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.4 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
